text: Another case of registry folders disappearing: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/edit-pluto-notebook-seems-to-delete-contents-of-julia-registries/53111|https://discourse.julialang.org/t/edit-pluto-notebook-seems-to-delete-contents-of-julia-registries/53111>

attachments.title: EDIT - Pluto notebook seems to delete contents of `.julia/registries`
attachments.text: So after a few to many edits and updates, here is a rewrite of the post. As it seems to be more pluto oriented, I will paste a copy of the rewrite as an issue over at GitHub. Original post at the bottom. The problem seems to be that when running a pluto notebook, one of two things happen: Everything runs smoothly Or, the more probable case lately: The notebook is not responsive, and the content of .julia/registries is deleted (as observed in real-time). Not responsive means that it appears t...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: EDIT - Pluto notebook seems to delete contents of `.julia/registries`

elements.text: Another case of registry folders disappearing:

text: The registry update is (i) download new registry to tmp, (ii) delete old registry in .julia/registries and (iii) copy from tmp to .julia.

elements.text: The registry update is (i) download new registry to tmp, (ii) delete old registry in .julia/registries and (iii) copy from tmp to .julia.

text: It is expected that they will be deleted, so the problem seems to be that they are not getting copied from tmp

elements.text: It is expected that they will be deleted, so the problem seems to be that they are not getting copied from tmp
